snippet: The Obama administration on Wednesday noted the milestone after years of slow growth and said health care would account for 20 percent of the economy by 2025....
abstract: Dept of Health and Human Services report, published in journal Health Affairs, finds that national health spending will average over $10,000 per person this year, milestone after years of low growth; also estimates health spending will account for 20 percent of economy by 2025.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Wednesday noted the milestone after years of slow growth and said health care would account for 20 percent of the economy by 2025.

headline.main: National Health Spending to Surpass $10,000 a Person in 2016
headline.print_headline: Spending on Health to Hit High This Year

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
